statement.tex: \text{A manufacturer produces nuts and bolts.}\\ \text{It takes 1 hour of work on machine A and}\\ \text{3 hours on machine B to produce a package}\\ \text{of nuts. It takes 3 hours on machine A and}\\ \text{1 hour on machine B to produce a package}\\ \text{of bolts. He earns a profit of Rs 17.50 per}\\ \text{package on nuts and Rs 7.00 per package on}\\ \text{bolts. How many packages of each should be}\\ \text{produced each day so as to maximise his profit,}\\ \text{if he operates his machines for at the most}\\ \text{12 hours a day.}

step.tex: \text{We need to maximise Total Profit} = T(x, y)\\ T = x\left(\dfrac{\text{pkgs}}{\text{day}}\right)\cdot 17.50\left(\dfrac{\text{Rs.}}{\text{pkgs}}\right) +\\ \qquad y\left(\dfrac{pkgs}{day}\right)\cdot 7\left(\dfrac{\text{Rs.}}{\text{pkgs}}\right) \\ \implies T = 17.5x + 7y
\text{We need to maximise Total Packages} = T(x, y)\\ T = x\left(\dfrac{\text{pkgs}}{\text{day}}\right) + y\left(\dfrac{pkgs}{day}\right) \\ \implies T = x + y

\text{Machine A can only be used for 12 hrs/day,}\\ x(pkg)\cdot 1\left(\dfrac{hr}{pkg}\right)+ y(pkg)\cdot 3\left(\dfrac{hr}{pkg}\right) \le 12hr\\ \implies x+3y \le 12\\
\text{Machine B can only be used for 12 hrs/day,}\\ x(pkg)\cdot 3\left(\dfrac{hr}{pkg}\right)+ y(pkg)\cdot 1\dfrac{hr}{pkg}\le 12hr \\ \implies 3x+y\le 12\\
\text{Number of packages cannot be negative}\\ \implies x\ge 0,\, y\ge 0

\text{Machines A and B can only be used for a}\\ \text{total of 12 hrs/day (6 hours each),}\\ x(pkg)\cdot 1\left(\dfrac{hr}{pkg}\right)+ y(pkg)\cdot 3\left(\dfrac{hr}{pkg}\right) \le 6hr\\ \implies x+3y \le 6\\
x(pkg)\cdot 3\left(\dfrac{hr}{pkg}\right)+ y(pkg)\cdot 1\dfrac{hr}{pkg}\le 6hr \\ \implies 3x+y\le 6\\
\text{Number of packages cannot be negative}\\ \implies x\ge 0,\, y\ge 0
step.reason: \text{Each machine can individually be used for 12 hrs}\\ \text{daily.}
\text{As per the constraints, the feasible region,}\\ \text{is bounded by the x and y axes and the area}\\ \text{below lines }x+3y=12 \text{ and } 3x+y=12

step.tex: \begin{align} \text{Corner Point} \qquad & T= 17.50x + 7.00y \\ (0, 4) \qquad &28 \\ (0, 0) \qquad &0 \\ (4, 0) \qquad &70 \\ (3, 3) \qquad &73.5 \\ \end{align}\\ \text{No maximum can be predicted.}

choices.tex: \text{3 packages of nuts and 6 packages of bolts}\\ \text{for a daily profit of Rs.94.50}
\text{6 packages of nuts and 6 packages of bolts}\\ \text{for a daily profit of Rs.147}
\text{6 packages of nuts and 3 packages of bolts}\\ \text{for a daily profit of Rs.126}
\text{3 packages of nuts and 3 packages of bolts}\\ \text{for a daily profit of Rs.73.50}
